security.title: Security
security.warning:
Security warning — please read.

OpenClaw is a hobby project and still in beta. Expect sharp edges.
This bot can read files and run actions if tools are enabled.
A bad prompt can trick it into doing unsafe things.

If you're not comfortable with basic security and access control, don't run OpenClaw.
Ask someone experienced to help before enabling tools or exposing it to the internet.

Recommended baseline:
- Pairing/allowlists + mention gating.
- Sandbox + least-privilege tools.
- Keep secrets out of the agent's reachable filesystem.
- Use the strongest available model for any bot with tools or untrusted inboxes.

Run regularly:
openclaw security audit --deep
openclaw security audit --fix

Must read: https://docs.openclaw.ai/gateway/security
security.confirm: I understand this is powerful and inherently risky. Continue?

Many skill dependencies are shipped via Homebrew.
Without brew, you'll need to build from source or download releases manually.

systemd.label: Systemd
systemd.unavailable: Systemd user services are unavailable. Skipping lingering checks and service install.
systemd.lingerReason: Linux installs use a systemd user service by default. Without lingering, systemd stops the user session on logout/idle and kills the Gateway.
systemd.unavailableSkip: Systemd user services are unavailable; skipping service install. Use your container supervisor or `docker compose up -d`.

hatch.intro:
This is the defining action that makes your agent you.
Please take your time.
The more you tell it, the better the experience will be.
We will send: "Wake up, my friend!"

webSearch.label: Web search (optional)
webSearch.keyInEnv: API key: provided via BRAVE_API_KEY env var (Gateway environment).
webSearch.disabled:
If you want your agent to be able to search the web, you'll need an API key.

OpenClaw uses Brave Search for the `web_search` tool. Without a Brave Search API key, web search won't work.

Set it up interactively:
- Run: {{command}}
- Enable web_search and paste your Brave Search API key

Alternative: set BRAVE_API_KEY in the Gateway environment (no config changes).
Docs: https://docs.openclaw.ai/tools/web

telegram.botTokenHelp:
1) Open Telegram and chat with @BotFather
2) Run /newbot (or /mybots)
3) Copy the token (looks like 123456:ABC...)
Tip: you can also set TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN in your env.
Docs: {{docsLink}}
Website: https://openclaw.ai
telegram.userIdHelp:
1) DM your bot, then read from.id in `{{logsCommand}}` (safest)
2) Or call https://api.telegram.org/bot<bot_token>/getUpdates and read message.from.id
3) Third-party: DM @userinfobot or @getidsbot
Docs: {{docsLink}}
Website: https://openclaw.ai
telegram.tokenMissing: Telegram token missing; username lookup is unavailable.
telegram.couldNotResolve: Could not resolve: {{unresolved}}. Use @username or numeric id.

discord.botTokenHelp:
1) Discord Developer Portal → Applications → New Application
2) Bot → Add Bot → Reset Token → copy token
3) OAuth2 → URL Generator → scope 'bot' → invite to your server
Tip: enable Message Content Intent if you need message text. (Bot → Privileged Gateway Intents → Message Content Intent)
Docs: {{docsLink}}
discord.allowlistHelp:
Allowlist Discord DMs by username (we resolve to user ids).
Examples:
- 123456789012345678
- @alice
- alice#1234
Multiple entries: comma-separated.
Docs: {{docsLink}}
discord.tokenMissing: Bot token missing; use numeric user ids (or mention form) only.
discord.failedResolve: Failed to resolve usernames. Try again.
discord.channelLookupFailed: Channel lookup failed; keeping entries as typed. {{error}}

whatsapp.needOwnerNumber: We need the sender/owner number so OpenClaw can allowlist you.
whatsapp.personalNumberPrompt: Your personal WhatsApp number (the phone you will message from)
whatsapp.dmAccessHelp:
WhatsApp direct chats are gated by `channels.whatsapp.dmPolicy` + `channels.whatsapp.allowFrom`.
- pairing (default): unknown senders get a pairing code; owner approves
- allowlist: unknown senders are blocked
- open: public inbound DMs (requires allowFrom to include "*")
- disabled: ignore WhatsApp DMs

Current: dmPolicy={{policy}}, allowFrom={{allowFrom}}
Docs: {{docsLink}}
whatsapp.personalPhone: This is my personal phone number

signal.allowlistHelp:
Allowlist Signal DMs by sender id.
Examples:
- +15555550123
- uuid:123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000
Multiple entries: comma-separated.
Docs: {{docsLink}}
signal.cliNotFoundHint: signal-cli not found. Install it, then rerun this step or set channels.signal.cliPath.

slack.tokensHelp:
1) Slack API → Create App → From scratch
2) Add Socket Mode + enable it to get the app-level token (xapp-...)
3) OAuth & Permissions → install app to workspace (xoxb- bot token)
4) Enable Event Subscriptions (socket) for message events
5) App Home → enable the Messages tab for DMs
Tip: set SLACK_BOT_TOKEN + SLACK_APP_TOKEN in your env.
Docs: {{docsLink}}

Manifest (JSON):
{{manifest}}
slack.botNamePrompt: Slack bot display name (used for manifest)
slack.envVarsDetected: SLACK_BOT_TOKEN + SLACK_APP_TOKEN detected. Use env vars?
slack.allowlistHelp:
Allowlist Slack DMs by username (we resolve to user ids).
Examples:
- U12345678
- @alice
Multiple entries: comma-separated.
Docs: {{docsLink}}
slack.tokenMissing: Slack token missing; use user ids (or mention form) only.
slack.failedResolve: Failed to resolve usernames. Try again.
slack.channelLookupFailed: Channel lookup failed; keeping entries as typed. {{error}}

imessage.allowlistHelp:
Allowlist iMessage DMs by handle or chat target.
Examples:
- +15555550123
- user@example.com
- chat_id:123
- chat_guid:... or chat_identifier:...
Multiple entries: comma-separated.
Docs: {{docsLink}}
imessage.cliPathRequired: imsg CLI path required to enable iMessage.
imessage.nextStepsHelp:
This is still a work in progress.
Ensure OpenClaw has Full Disk Access to Messages DB.
Grant Automation permission for Messages when prompted.
List chats with: imsg chats --limit 20
Docs: {{docsLink}}

tui.localShellAllow: Allow local shell commands for this session?
tui.localShellWarning: This runs commands on YOUR machine (not the gateway) and may delete files or reveal secrets.
tui.localShellSelectPrompt: Select Yes/No (arrows + Enter), Esc to cancel.
tui.localShellEnabled: local shell: enabled for this session
tui.localShellNotEnabledSession: local shell: not enabled for this session

banner.title: OpenClaw
taglines: Your terminal just grew claws—type something and let the bot pinch the busywork.
Welcome to the command line: where dreams compile and confidence segfaults.
Gateway online—please keep hands, feet, and appendages inside the shell at all times.
I speak fluent bash, mild sarcasm, and aggressive tab-completion energy.
One CLI to rule them all, and one more restart because you changed the port.
Hot reload for config, cold sweat for deploys.
Automation with claws: minimal fuss, maximal pinch.
If you're lost, run doctor; if you're brave, run prod; if you're wise, run tests.
Your inbox, your infra, your rules.
The UNIX philosophy meets your DMs.
Your messages, your servers, your control.

update.quip1: Leveled up! New skills unlocked. You're welcome.
update.quip2: Fresh code, same lobster. Miss me?
update.quip3: Back and better. Did you even notice I was gone?
update.quip4: Update complete. I learned some new tricks while I was out.
update.quip6: I've evolved. Try to keep up.
update.quip7: New version, who dis? Oh right, still me but shinier.
update.quip8: Patched, polished, and ready to pinch. Let's go.
update.quip9: The lobster has molted. Harder shell, sharper claws.
update.quip10: Update done! Check the changelog or just trust me, it's good.
update.quip11: Reborn from the boiling waters of npm. Stronger now.
update.quip12: I went away and came back smarter. You should try it sometime.
update.quip13: Update complete. The bugs feared me, so they left.
update.quip14: New version installed. Old version sends its regards.
update.quip16: I've seen things you wouldn't believe. Anyway, I'm updated.
update.quip17: Back online. The changelog is long but our friendship is longer.
update.quip18: Upgraded! Peter fixed stuff. Blame him if it breaks.
update.quip19: Molting complete. Please don't look at my soft shell phase.
update.quip20: Version bump! Same chaos energy, fewer crashes (probably).
update.upgradingCompletion: Upgrading shell completion to cached version...
update.nonGitDirectory: OPENCLAW_GIT_DIR points at a non-git directory: {{dir}}. Set OPENCLAW_GIT_DIR to an empty folder or an openclaw checkout.
update.notCoreCheckout: OPENCLAW_GIT_DIR does not look like a core checkout: {{dir}}.
update.configInvalidCannotSetChannel: Config is invalid; cannot set update channel.
update.downgradeRerunTty: Downgrading can break configuration. Re-run in a TTY to confirm.
update.downgradeConfirmMessage: Downgrading from {{from}} to {{to}} can break configuration. Continue?
update.tagIgnoredForGit: Note: --tag applies to npm installs only; git updates ignore it.
update.skippedDirty: Skipped: working directory has uncommitted changes. Commit or stash them first.
update.skippedNotGitInstall: Skipped: this OpenClaw install isn't a git checkout, and the package manager couldn't be detected. Update via your package manager, then run `{{doctorCmd}}` and `{{restartCmd}}`.
update.skippingPluginsConfigInvalid: Skipping plugin updates: config is invalid.
update.manualRestartHint: You may need to restart the service manually: {{command}}
update.tipDoctorAndRestart: Tip: Run `{{doctorCmd}}`, then `{{restartCmd}}` to apply updates to a running gateway.
update.tipRestart: Tip: Run `{{command}}` to apply updates to a running gateway.
update.wizardRequiresTty: Update wizard requires a TTY. Use `openclaw update --channel <stable|beta|dev>` instead.
update.createGitCheckout: Create a git checkout at {{dir}}? (override via OPENCLAW_GIT_DIR)
update.restartAfterUpdate: Restart the gateway service after update?
update.cliDescription: Update OpenClaw to the latest version
update.cliOptionNoRestart: Skip restarting the gateway service after a successful update
update.cliOptionTag: Override npm dist-tag or version for this update
update.cliOptionTimeout: Timeout for each update step in seconds (default: 1200)
update.statusDescription: Show update channel and version status
update.statusTimeoutOption: Timeout for update checks in seconds (default: 3)
update.helpGitCheckouts: Git checkouts: fetches, rebases, installs deps, builds, and runs doctor
update.helpNpmInstalls: npm installs: updates via detected package manager
update.helpChannelPersist: Use --channel stable|beta|dev to persist the update channel in config
update.helpChannelStatus: Run openclaw update status to see the active channel and source
update.helpTagOneOff: Use --tag <dist-tag|version> for a one-off npm update without persisting
update.helpExampleTag: One-off update to a dist-tag or version
update.helpNoteGlobalInstalls: For global installs: auto-updates via detected package manager when possible (see docs/install/updating.md)
update.helpNoteSkipDirty: Skips update if the working directory has uncommitted changes
update.statusNoteChannel: - Shows current update channel (stable/beta/dev) and source
update.statusNoteGit: - Includes git tag/branch/SHA for source checkouts

completion.unsupportedShell: Automated installation not supported for {{shell}} yet.

cron.schedulerDisabledWarning: warning: cron scheduler is disabled in the Gateway; jobs are saved but will not run automatically.
cron.schedulerReEnable: Re-enable with `cron.enabled: true` (or remove `cron.enabled: false`) and restart the Gateway.
cron.errorInvalidAt: Invalid --at; use ISO time or duration like 20m
cron.errorAnnounceOrNoDeliver: Choose at most one of --announce or --no-deliver
cron.errorMainNoMessage: Main jobs cannot use --message; use --system-event or --session isolated.
cron.errorIsolatedNoSystemEvent: Isolated jobs cannot use --system-event; use --message or --session main.
cron.errorOneScheduleChange: Choose at most one schedule change
cron.errorOnePayloadChange: Choose at most one payload change
